intro: Maerua bequaertii, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces clusters of small, white, ball-shaped flowers that bloom in the rainy season. Its leaves are usually small, narrow, and arranged opposite on the stems. Maerua bequaertii is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
